page.title: 09SERVICES AND AMENITIES
page.content: The Parish Council consists of 9 men and 3 women. They issue free bus tokens to Old Age Pensioners and are Trustees of Charity for the Coronation Hall. The latter was built in 1953 and is used for clubs, bingo, the annual Flower Show, public performances of plays, jumble sales and other social events. There is a resident policeman in Kingsland. Postal services include collections from post boxes once daily and twice daily from the post office. Postal deliveries are made once daily except Sundays. There are two telephone kiosks in the area. Accommodation is available for visitors at one inn and two bed and breakfast establishments. A mobile library visits the area once a month. Eyton Church seats 100 and dates from the 14th century. One service is held each Sunday.
